commit.author: lionel
commit.comment: Fixed the path to the php module

module.recipe:
#!/bin/bash -x

function ss-display {
    $(which ss-display) "$1" || echo "$1"
}

set -e

ss-display "Updating package index"
apt-get clean
apt-get update

ss-display "Installing WordPress manifest"
puppet module install hunner-wordpress
puppet module install puppetlabs-apache

cat > httpd.pp << 'EOF'
class { 'apache': 
  mpm_module => 'prefork',
}

apache::vhost { 'wordpres':
  vhost_name => '*',
  port       => 8080,
  docroot    => '/opt/wordpress',
}

apache::mod { 'php5': }

EOF

ss-display "Configuring Apache"
puppet apply -v httpd.pp

ln -s ../mods-available/php5.conf /etc/apache2/mods-enabled/php5.conf
echo 'LoadModule php5_module /usr/lib/apache2/modules/libphp5.so' > /etc/apache2/mods-available/php5.load  

service apache2 restart
module.description: Installs and configures WordPress using Puppet

target.name: execute
target.content:
#!/bin/bash -x

set -e
set -x

export admin_username=admin
export admin_password=$(< /dev/urandom tr -dc _A-Z-a-z-0-9 | head -c12)
export admin_email=$(ss-get admin_email)
export wordpress_title=$(ss-get wordpress_title)
export mysql_password=$(< /dev/urandom tr -dc _A-Z-a-z-0-9 | head -c12)
export public_hostname=$(ss-get hostname)

ss-set -- mysql_password $mysql_password
ss-set -- admin_password $admin_password

cat > wp.pp << EOF
class { 'wordpress':
  wp_owner    => 'www-data',
  wp_group    => 'www-data',
  db_user     => 'wordpress',
  db_password => '$(mysql_password)'
}
EOF

ss-display "Installing WordPress"
puppet apply -v wp.pp

ss-display "Configuring WordPress"

base_url="http://${public_hostname}:8080"
url="${base_url}/wp-admin/install.php?step=2"

# quote the title since it can contain spaces
/usr/bin/curl \
    --data-urlencode "weblog_title=${wordpress_title}" \
    -d "user_name=${admin_username}" \
    -d "admin_password=${admin_password}" \
    -d "admin_password2=${admin_password}" \
    -d "admin_email=${admin_email}" \
    -d "blog_public=1" -v ${url} >> /tmp/curl.out

ss-set ss:url.service "${base_url}"
ss-set url.service "${base_url}"

ss-display "WordPress ready to go!"

subTarget.name: recipe
subTarget.content:
#!/bin/bash -x

function ss-display {
    $(which ss-display) "$1" || echo "$1"
}

set -e

ss-display "Updating package index"
apt-get clean
apt-get update

ss-display "Installing WordPress manifest"
puppet module install hunner-wordpress
puppet module install puppetlabs-apache

cat > httpd.pp << 'EOF'
class { 'apache': 
  mpm_module => 'prefork',
}

apache::vhost { 'wordpres':
  vhost_name => '*',
  port       => 8080,
  docroot    => '/opt/wordpress',
}

apache::mod { 'php5': }

EOF

ss-display "Configuring Apache"
puppet apply -v httpd.pp

ln -s ../mods-available/php5.conf /etc/apache2/mods-enabled/php5.conf
echo 'LoadModule php5_module /usr/lib/apache2/modules/libphp5.so' > /etc/apache2/mods-available/php5.load  

service apache2 restart

subTarget.name: execute
subTarget.content:
#!/bin/bash -xe

# set the service url to SSH url
url=$(ss-get --timeout=180 url.ssh)
ss-set url.service "${url}"
ss-set ss:url.service "${url}"

#!/bin/bash -x

set -e
set -x

export admin_username=admin
export admin_password=$(< /dev/urandom tr -dc _A-Z-a-z-0-9 | head -c12)
export admin_email=$(ss-get admin_email)
export wordpress_title=$(ss-get wordpress_title)
export mysql_password=$(< /dev/urandom tr -dc _A-Z-a-z-0-9 | head -c12)
export public_hostname=$(ss-get hostname)

ss-set -- mysql_password $mysql_password
ss-set -- admin_password $admin_password

cat > wp.pp << EOF
class { 'wordpress':
  wp_owner    => 'www-data',
  wp_group    => 'www-data',
  db_user     => 'wordpress',
  db_password => '$(mysql_password)'
}
EOF

ss-display "Installing WordPress"
puppet apply -v wp.pp

ss-display "Configuring WordPress"

base_url="http://${public_hostname}:8080"
url="${base_url}/wp-admin/install.php?step=2"

# quote the title since it can contain spaces
/usr/bin/curl \
    --data-urlencode "weblog_title=${wordpress_title}" \
    -d "user_name=${admin_username}" \
    -d "admin_password=${admin_password}" \
    -d "admin_password2=${admin_password}" \
    -d "admin_email=${admin_email}" \
    -d "blog_public=1" -v ${url} >> /tmp/curl.out

ss-set ss:url.service "${base_url}"
ss-set url.service "${base_url}"

ss-display "WordPress ready to go!"

parameter.name: wordpress_title
parameter.description: Title (name) to give to the WordPress instance

module.name: apps/WordPress/wordpress

parameter.name: nuvlabox-albert-einstein.is.firewall
parameter.description: If this flag is set, the instance will be started on the internal network and on the natted network so it can act as a firewall for instances on the internal network.

parameter.instructions: If you don't know what is a security group or if you don't want to take care of them, you can use the special value slipstream_managed to let SlipStream generate a security group with everything allowed.
parameter.name: cyclone-de1.security.groups

runtimeParameter.description: State of the VM, according to the cloud layer

runtimeParameter.description: Global complete flag, set when run completed
